results.title: Customer Success Manager - Digital Identity & Authentication
results.description:

Incognia‚Äôs award-winning technology uses location signals and motion sensors to silently recognize trusted users based on their unique behavior patterns and is a key enabler for zero-factor authentication. Deployed in over 200 million devices, Incognia delivers a highly precise and predictive risk signal with extremely low false-positive rates.

¬†

Incognia is privately held and headquartered in Palo Alto, California with teams in New York, and S√£o Paulo and Recife, Brazil.

¬†

Our values:

  • We don't want to know the real world identities of our users

  • We are fast problem solvers

  • We respect each other and are free to be ourselves

  • We work as a team to win together

  • We seek what is best for our future

¬†

The team:

The Customer Success team is a multidisciplinary team, we work on the border between the technical (fraud and technology) and business (relationship, processes, upsell) worlds. We play a central role in the operation, helping to coordinate internal teams in order to resolve all customer-related issues. Therefore, we also exercise an internal leadership role, which requires maturity and negotiation skills. Finally, we have a very strong partnership with the sales team and the team responsible for integrations to ensure customer success at all stages of the process.

  • Build and foster relationships with key decision makers and stakeholders across multiple customers.

    • Monitor usage and performance metrics;

    • Monitor the resolution of internal improvements that impact the customer;

    • Periodic meetings with the client for accountability and follow-up;

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business or technology fields;

results.title: Senior Product Designer, Merchant Risk Experience
results.description:
Company Description

Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn‚Äôt work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we‚Äôve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes ‚Äì large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We‚Äôre building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

The Risk team works to protect the people that trust Square, by minimizing the financial risks that come with running a business. We keep our sellers safe while $25B+ flows through Square annually, and along the way help each other make calculated risk/reward trade offs to grow sellers, and make complicated and sometimes painful processes understandable to all.¬†

We are looking for a Product Designer to join Risk in delivering critical knowledge and experiences to our sellers that help them make sense of these complex situations in money movement‚Äîgetting sellers their money faster and protecting them along the way. You will work alongside other product designers, content designers, product managers, researchers, engineering, and legal to increase usability and ease of use across Risk experiences.



Qualifications

You will:

  • Design from a customer-first perspective, advocating for the customer and approaching problems with an experience mindset.

  • Find opportunities to improve systems and processes to create more value in our business and our customer experience.

  • Facilitate workshops, conduct research, and work cross-functionally to create a collective understanding of our tools, systems and services.

  • Build strong relationships with cross-functional team members.

  • Create elegant and clear journey maps, service blueprints, and documentation of systems.

  • Create professional, well-thought-out designs using established design systems.

  • Apply metrics, data, design research, user testing, customer support insights, and more to inform experience decisions.

  • Manage and prioritize your workload of multiple projects with different collaborators with moderate guidance from design leadership.

  • Always think about how your work fits into the full ecosystem during all phases of the design process.

¬†

You have:

  • At least 5 years of relevant professional experience.

  • A portfolio of shipped work on which you were the primary designer, completed with moderate guidance from design leadership.

Experience in service design (Systems Design, UX/UI Design, Organizational Design).

ABOUT US

MATCHESFASHION started with a single shop in Wimbledon more than 30 years ago and has grown into one of the biggest global destinations in online luxury for men and women, carrying a modern edit of 650+ established and new-generation designers, delivering to over 176 countries. With offices in the UK and Hong Kong, our aspiration is to be the most personal luxury shopping site in the world. In London, our head office is based in The Shard, while our creative hub is in Here East, and 5 Carlos Place, a recently updated retail concept combining digital and physical elements, is based in Mayfair.

¬†

OUR COMMITMENT TO DEI

We want to attract the very best talent and create an inclusive environment that celebrates the diversity of our people and enables them to do their best work. We recognise the world is not a perfect place and that bias exists, which is why we are committed to ensuring that all our people processes are equitable.

¬†

THE CUSTOMER CARE TEAM

Customer Care is a dynamic team of talented, customer-focused, resourceful, problem-solving individuals, and we are passionate about all things related to our customers‚Äô experience. Our team is highly collaborative, with our finger on the pulse ‚Äì ready to solve any problem. In this role not only will you have the pleasure of assisting our customers, you will constantly be learning and find yourself gaining exposure to other facets of the business. We champion our people and provide a dynamic, diverse and supportive workplace. We are a team built on a nonhierarchical environment with great people from diverse backgrounds. Our team embodies the can-do spirit ‚Äì as well as always innovating, we are continuously driving forward MATCHESFASHION values.

¬†

¬†

ROLE: You probably know how this story goes‚Ä¶

A customer calls. Her name is Alison, she is calling from New York about an issue with her MATCHESFASHION order. In her previous experience with other brands these phone calls are time-consuming and unhelpful, so she is already preparing herself for an irritating conversation. Except that Customer Care means something different at MATCHESFASHION and it‚Äôs YOU that picked up her call. You are curious and keen to find out how you can help her, and you have the expertise to solve her problem (expertise which we help you refine with our comprehensive training as well as learning & development opportunities). You are polite and proactive; in the end she lowers her guard and opens up. Her order is something she needs for an event that may change her career. Whilst you find out what has happened with her order you realise you share a common interest in art galleries and travel, she suggests her favorite rooftop bar for you to visit if you are ever in New York. In the meantime, you have solved the problem. She is so grateful; you made her day! You wish her luck and close the call.

And just like that you have shown her that luxury at MATCHESFASHION is more than the content of the parcel she will receive soon (thanks to you!). It is in the expertise, generosity of spirit and in the connection created by its people.

Since our first MATCHESFASHION shop in Wimbledon over 30 years ago, providing a meaningful and personal luxury experience for our customers has been at the heart of what we do. Now are one of the biggest global destinations in online luxury for men and women, with a modern edit of over 450 established and new generation designers, delivering to over 176 countries. Famous for our fashion point of view, with a forward-looking focus on innovation and emerging talent, what remains the same as we grow is our focus on customers experience.

Everyday our Customer Care team connect and support our customers via phone, email, chat and social working collaboratively across the business and team to solve problems, help customers to place orders, making the right decisions and taking accountability for every single customers MATCHESFASHION journey. As our business grows so does our team. We are looking for people like you to come and help us create these experiences for each one of our customers every day. We like to consider ourselves a ‚Äúone stop shop‚Äù. When you‚Äôre the person that our lucky customer connects with, you‚Äôll be able to give them a concierge style service whatever their enquiry.

If you have experience in fast paced customer facing environments, are eager to learn and in search of an opportunity to distinguish yourself for your outstanding customer care talent in a leading luxury shopping destination you have come to the right place.

¬†

ABOUT YOU:

  • Love to solve a problem and take responsibility
  • Are resilient with the tenacity to not give up until the problem is solved
  • Have experience fast paced customer facing environments
  • Enjoy getting stuck in and working with your team and with business partners to find the right solution
  • Have fluent English both written and spoken
  • Know your way around Microsoft Office
  • Are able to work flexible shift patterns including evenings, weekends and bank holidays
  • Are keen to learn more about the luxury fashion industry and the exciting brands that we stock on MATCHESFASHION
  • This role is remote working and not office based.

¬†

BENEFITS

  • 50% employee discount
  • Hybrid working, with option to work across three locations ‚Äì The Shard, Here East and Carlos Place (role dependent)
  • Breakfast provided at The Shard and Here East locations
  • 33 days holiday (including bank holidays), and the option to buy up to 5 additional days
  • Extra day off for your birthday
  • Access to Health Cash Plan including dental, glasses and contact lenses, physiotherapy and more.

Please Note: This role is fully remote, and we are open to candidates based all over the UK. This role is full time (37.5 hours) however part time hours are available. Shifts will be issued on a rota basis and consist of evenings and weekends. We would also welcome someone who is looking for evening only or night shifts.

Further details of hours available can be discussed at interview stage

results.title: Copywriter
results.description:
Position Summary

The person who fulfills the Copywriter role will bring a powerful combination of both big-picture, strategic thinking, and tactics-focused abilities. They will write short- and long-form copy for a wide range of deliverables. They will clearly communicate complex healthcare topics in a user-friendly, digestible way.

¬†

Key Areas of Responsibility

  • Interpret creative briefs and client needs ‚Äî and ask helpful questions to fill any gaps necessary to complete assignments.
  • Ideate, execute, a speak convincingly of conceptual ideas.
  • Write clear, compelling, persuasive copy for email campaigns, websites, newsletters, brochures, social ads, video scripts, and other copywriting deliverables.
  • Adapt to different industries and audiences.
  • Adapt to each client‚Äôs tone, style, and voice guidelines.
  • The ability to develop persuasive messaging around business and marketing objectives.
  • Revise content based on internal and client feedback.
  • Ensure copywriting deliverables and internal documents are in tip-top shape from a spelling, punctuation, and grammar perspective.
  • Collaborate with our editorial, account management, project management, client engagement, and design teams.

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of copywriting experience, preferably in a creative setting (agency, in-house creative team, etc.).
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in journalism, marketing, or related field.
  • A portfolio that demonstrates exciting work that features a range of conceptual and tactical writing.
  • Experience writing for healthcare or other technical/regulated industries is a plus.
  • Aligns with our values: People, Commitment, Aspiration, Trustworthiness & Impact.
  • Demonstrates these Brado skills: Agile, Bold, Innovative, Curious, Empathetic, Teamwork, Self-starter, Verbal & Written Communication, Creative Thinking.
  • Demonstrates these role-specific skills:
    • Excellent research skills and the ability to interpret and clearly communicate complex concepts.
    • A strong grasp of A.P. style guidelines and the ability to proofread and edit copy for grammar, accuracy, clarity, flow, voice, and actionability.
    • Impeccable time-management skills and respect for deadlines.
    • The ability to receive and act on constructive criticism.
    • A proven track record of improving copy based on internal and client feedback.
    • The professionalism to present work internally.
  • Adhere with all Brado and client required training and guidelines for market research and healthcare industry regulations and laws. Specifically (but not limited to) Pharmacovigilance (PV) and Healthcare Providers (HCPs) processes and reporting, Ethics, Confidentiality, Data Privacy / Security and Harassment.

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
  • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
  • Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • Training & Development
  • Work From Home
